content.description:
Start as for

Persephone

, but climb straight above and out of the roof. Great movement on good holds leads to the crux lip encounter and slab topout.
content.location:
Under the

Persephone

roof, this starts on the same campus edge as

Persephone

.

content.description: Start with your right hand on a small crimp and your left hand on a sloper on the arete. Do fun compression moves to the top.
content.location: This is the arete facing uphill on the back of the Persephone Bloc. From Persephone, walk through the cave and out of the upper left side.

content.description: Begin with a campus start off of the obvious edge, and climb through jugs up and left until turning the corner of the arete and topping out the beautiful face.
content.location:
Head up and left through the talus from the Calypso Boulder. The approach from here is about 3 minutes.

It is located under the massive, floating boulder directly behind the Rain Clock Boulder and left of the Exit Music Boulder.

climbs.name: Hades
climbs.fa: James Hada, Brett Hoffman, Matt Poiesz

content.description:
Start on a jug and climb the tall, colorful face on good edges.

You should do this one.
content.location:
This is the line on the face. Itâ€™s on the opposite side of the boulder as

Persephone

and

Telemachus

.
